Quiz.tsx

content.thinking:
Now I have a good understanding of the codebase. Let me plan what needs to be done:

1. The issue asks to build a results page with ranked trainer cards
2. The quiz collects `QuizAnswers` which include: goal, style, feedback, structure, checkins, experience
3. The `calculateScore` function takes a `TrainerProfile` and `UserPreferences` 
4. The trainers.json has trainer profiles with: id, name, goal, style, feedback, structure, checkins

The issue says:
- Calculate scores client-side against all Toronto trainers
- Display ranked cards: name, photo, area, specialty, fit score badge, fit label, link to external website


- Top matches should be visually distinct

Looking at the current state, trainers.json is missing photo, area, specialty, and external website URL fields. The quiz's `isDone` state currently shows a summary of answers rather than trainer results, so I need to add a Results component. My implementation plan is to update trainers.json with the missing fields, create a Results component that displays ranked trainer cards with score badges, and modify the Quiz component to show Results instead of the current summary view.

The `UserPreferences` type only includes goal, style, feedback, structure, and checkinsâ€”experience isn't part of it, even though it appears in `QuizAnswers`. For the results page, I'll take the quiz answers as UserPreferences, calculate scores for all trainers, sort them descending, and display cards showing name, photo, area, specialty, fit score badge, fit label (Great/Good/Poor Match), and website link. I'll replace the current summary view in the Quiz component's `isDone` state with the Results component.

Now I need to pass the quiz answers to Results and check the package.json to see what tools I'm working with.

content.thinking:
Now I have a thorough understanding of the codebase. Let me plan the implementation:

1. **Update `trainers.json`** to add: `photo` (placeholder URL), `area` (Toronto neighborhood), `specialty` (human-readable), `website` (external URL)

2. **Update `score.ts`** to add a `TrainerProfile` extended type or update the existing one with the new fields

3. **Create `Results.tsx`** component - ranked trainer cards

4. **Update `Quiz.tsx`** - when done, render Results instead of the summary screen

The issue mentions:
- Name: done (in trainers.json)


- Photo: needs to be added
- Area: needs to be added
- Specialty: needs to be added
- Fit score badge: calculate from score.ts
- Fit label: from scoreLabel()
- Link to external website: needs to be added to trainers
- Top matches visually distinct

For photos, I'll use placeholder images from a service like `https://ui-avatars.com/api/?name=Alex+Chen`, though I should consider whether to use local assets in the public folder instead since this is a real app.

Actually, I'm overthinking thisâ€”I'll generate initials-based avatar placeholders directly in the component rather than relying on external services, which keeps everything self-contained and doesn't depend on third-party URLs.

Now I'm adding location and specialty data to the trainers: Alex Chen in Downtown Toronto specializing in HIIT and fat loss, Jordan Lee in North York with powerlifting expertise, Sam Rivera in Scarborough focused on endurance training, Taylor Morgan in Etobicoke teaching yoga and mobility, and Casey Park in Midtown Toronto offering functional fitness. I'll also add placeholder website URLs for each trainer. For the visual design, I want the top-ranked match to stand out with a distinctive border or background treatment, and I'm thinking about how to display the match score prominently.

I'm planning to use color-coded badges for the match qualityâ€”green for scores above 80, blue or amber for 60-79, and gray for anything below 60â€”along with a numeric score and label. Each card will have a "Find Trainer" button to take action.

Now I'm setting up the implementation plan: creating a feature branch, updating the trainers data file with the new fields, extending the scoring logic to include display properties, building the Results component to show the ranked cards, and integrating it into the Quiz flow so it displays when the quiz is complete. The Quiz will pass the user's answers to Results, which will calculate and display the ranked matches.

Building the Results component... I'll add a photo field to the trainer data and render it with an image tag, falling back to initials if the image fails to load. To keep things simple without external dependencies, I'll just use local image paths and let the initials display handle missing images gracefully.

content.text: Now I have a clear picture of the codebase. Let me plan and implement the solution.

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat(FRG-125): build results page with ranked trainer cards

- Add area, specialty, website fields to trainers.json (5 Toronto trainers)
- Extend TrainerProfile type with display fields (area, specialty, website)
- Create Results component: scores all trainers client-side, sorts by score,
  renders ranked cards with initials avatar, specialty, area, fit score badge,
  fit label, and external website link; top match highlighted with Best Match banner
- Replace Quiz completion summary screen with Results component

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.command:
gh pr create --title "feat(FRG-125): build results page with ranked trainer cards" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
- Calculates compatibility scores client-side against all Toronto trainers using `calculateScore`
- Displays trainers sorted by score in ranked cards showing: initials avatar, name, specialty, area, fit score badge (0â€“100), fit label (Great/Good/Poor Match), and external website link
- Top match is visually distinct with an emerald highlight border and "Best Match" banner

## Test plan
- [ ] Complete the 6-question quiz and verify results page renders with all 5 trainers ranked
- [ ] Confirm top trainer card has emerald border and "Best Match" badge
- [ ] Confirm score badges: green for Great Match (â‰¥80), blue for Good Match (â‰¥60), gray for Poor Match (<60)
- [ ] Confirm "View Profile â†’" links open in a new tab
- [ ] Confirm "Start over" restarts the quiz
- [ ] Lint: `npm run lint` passes
- [ ] Tests: `npm run test` all 10 pass
- [ ] Build: `npm run build` succeeds

Closes FRG-125

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

input.body:
## Implementation Complete

**PR:** https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch/pull/3
**Branch:** `feature/FRG-125-results-page-ranked-trainer-cards`

### What was done

**Files changed:**
- `src/data/trainers.json` â€” Added `area` (Toronto neighbourhood), `specialty`, and `website` fields to all 5 trainers
- `src/lib/score.ts` â€” Extended `TrainerProfile` interface with `area: string`, `specialty: string`, `website: string`
- `app/components/Results.tsx` â€” New component: calculates scores client-side, sorts trainers by score, renders ranked cards with initials avatar, name, specialty, area, score badge, fit label, and "View Profile" link
- `app/components/Quiz.tsx` â€” Replaced the post-quiz preferences summary with the new Results component

### Decisions made
- **No real photos:** Used initials-based avatar (CSS circles) since there are no actual trainer images. The `photo` concept is represented by the initials display, which is more robust than a broken image.
- **Top match highlight:** The #1 ranked trainer gets an emerald border + "Best Match" pill badge for clear visual distinction.
- **Score badge colours:** emerald = Great Match (â‰¥80), blue = Good Match (â‰¥60), gray = Poor Match (<60), consistent with `scoreLabel` thresholds.
- `experience` answer from the quiz is collected but not used in scoring (unchanged from prior issue FRG-124) â€” it is excluded when building `UserPreferences` for `calculateScore`.

### Tests
All 10 existing unit tests pass. Build and lint are clean.

content.text: --- ## Status DONE ## What Changed - `src/data/trainers.json` â€” Added `area` (Toronto neighbourhood), `specialty`, and `website` to all 5 trainer records - `src/lib/score.ts` â€” Extended `TrainerProfile` interface with `area`, `specialty`, `website` fields - `app/components/Results.tsx` â€” New component: scores all trainers client-side, sorts descending, renders ranked cards (initials avatar, name, specialty, area, score badge, fit label, external link); top match gets emerald highlight + "Best Match" pill - `app/components/Quiz.tsx` â€” Replaced post-quiz summary screen with `` component ## Key Decisions - **Initials avatar instead of real photos** â€” no trainer images exist in the repo; initials in a CSS circle are more robust than broken `` tags - **`experience` field excluded from scoring** â€” it's collected by the quiz but `calculateScore` doesn't accept it; excluded when building `UserPreferences` (consistent with FRG-124 design) - **Score badge colours** tied to `scoreLabel` thresholds: emerald â‰¥80, blue â‰¥60, gray <60 ## PR / Branch - Branch: `feature/FRG-125-results-page-ranked-trainer-cards` - PR: https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch/pull/3
